channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-11199] One-time effort to pretty-print the Docbook XML, to make further patch review easier
item.description: Careful not to pretty-print literal layouts and document (at least in this JIRA) the pretty-printing process for next time.
item.summary: One-time effort to pretty-print the Docbook XML, to make further patch review easier

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
So, Oxygen has a reasonable pretty-print system for Docbook XML. You just go to the text view (non-wysiwyg), cmd+A to select-all, cmd+shift+P to pretty-print. It ignores <programlisting>, <screen>, <literallayout>, and others that seem reasonable. It wraps long lines when possible, as well. at around 100 characters, occasionally overflowing a character or two because of word breaks. Let me know if you want any of these settings tweaked and I will do it and re-submit the patch.

I can also look around for a command-line reformatter which we could hook in with the automatic builds or somehow with the check-in process, if you like that approach. I know that they exist because I've used one before, and specifically had it set up with reasonable defaults for Docbook. I just can't remember what it was called!

Would be good to identify a means of format checking on pre-commit (as we do for code) to help enforce the new style going forward. Probably better to do this rather than format on commit so that the workflow for docs patches remains identical to workflow for code patches.

Nick Dimiduk We should do that but in a different JIRA?

Misty, you need to update to latest before you generate the patch. You have changes that are undoing work that has happened since you last rebase (or do a diff against current head):

E.g. conf/hbase-env.sh
hbase-client/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/HColumnDescriptor.java

You could limit your diff to the directories that contain the docbook stuff. That'd help avoid your including unrelated changes.

Otherwise, sounds great to me. Until we find the command-line tool to enforce formatting, I think devs will be inclined to follow the convention of the existing xml.

Good stuff Misty Stanley-Jones
I hope this one won't have side effects. I apologize – still learning git.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12645673/HBASE-11199-1.patch
against trunk revision .
ATTACHMENT ID: 12645673

-1 @author. The patch appears to contain 2 @author tags which the Hadoop community has agreed to not allow in code contributions.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 17 new or modified tests.

-1 patch. The patch command could not apply the patch.

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/9541//console

This message is automatically generated.
This has all gone pear-shaped. I'll remove these patches and re-submit when I hopefully haven't screwed it up as much.
I hope this one works. I made sure it would merge with up-to-date trunk before submitting.
Rebased this patch since it was getting stale.

I tried the patch. It applied fine but when I tried mvn site it complained about missing para tags. I fixed one then ran into another. Does it work for you?

Saw this too.... Might be from Oxygen? Looks like should be reachable though:

Warning: org.apache.xerces.parsers.SAXParser: Feature 'http://javax.xml.XMLConstants/feature/secure-processing' is not recognized.
Warning: org.apache.xerces.parsers.SAXParser: Property 'http://javax.xml.XMLConstants/property/accessExternalDTD' is not recognized.
Warning: org.apache.xerces.parsers.SAXParser: Property 'http://www.oracle.com/xml/jaxp/properties/entityExpansionLimit' is not recognized.

I can dig in on the above if you want, np... just say.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12647032/HBASE-11199-2-rebased.patch
against trunk revision .
ATTACHMENT ID: 12647032

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 14 new or modified tests.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

-1 release audit. The applied patch generated 32 release audit warnings (more than the trunk's current 0 warnings).

-1 lineLengths. The patch introduces the following lines longer than 100:
+ xlink:href="http://hbase.apache.org/apidocs/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/client/HTable.html">HTable</link>
+ xlink:href="http://hbase.apache.org/apidocs/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/client/Get.html">Get</link>
+ xlink:href="http://hbase.apache.org/apidocs/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/client/HTable.html#get%28org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.Get%29">
+ xlink:href="http://hbase.apache.org/apidocs/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/client/Put.html">Put</link>
+ xlink:href="http://hbase.apache.org/apidocs/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/client/HTable.html#put%28org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.Put%29">
+ xlink:href="http://hbase.apache.org/apidocs/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/client/HTable.html#batch%28java.util.List%29">
+ xlink:href="http://hbase.apache.org/apidocs/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/client/Scan.html">Scan</link>
+ xlink:href="http://hbase.apache.org/apidocs/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/filter/InclusiveStopFilter.html">InclusiveStopFilter</link>
+ xlink:href="http://hbase.apache.org/apidocs/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/client/Delete.html">Delete</link>
+ xlink:href="http://hbase.apache.org/apidocs/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/client/HTable.html#delete%28org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.Delete%29">

-1 site. The patch appears to cause mvn site goal to fail.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/9612//testReport/
Release audit warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/9612//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/patchReleaseAuditProblems.txt
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/9612//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-hadoop2-compat.html

This message is automatically generated.

There were three or four other <para> errors because of re-nesting several <programlisting> tags to be outside the <para>s. I think the xerces errors were also a side effect of those. I'm getting a clean run from 'mvn site' now.
